A central control point for new session segments, PHP session management values, and CSRF token checking.
A session segment factory.
The CSRF token for this session.
A CSRF token factory, for lazy-creating the CSRF token.
Incoming cookies from the client, typically a copy of the $_COOKIE superglobal.
Session cookie parameters.
Constructor

tag.name: param
tag.description: An arry of cookies from the client, typically a copy of $_COOKIE.

docblock.description: Gets a new session segment instance by name.
docblock.long-description: Segments with the same name will be different objects but will reference the same $_SESSION values, so it is possible to have two or more objects that share state. For good or bad, this a function of how $_SESSION works.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the session segment, typically a fully-qualified class name.

docblock.description: Tells us if a session is available to be reactivated, but not if it has started yet.
Tells us if a session has started.
Starts a new session, or resumes an existing one.
Clears all session variables across all segments.
Writes session data from all segments and ends the session.
Destroys the session entirely.
Returns the CSRF token, creating it if needed (and thereby starting a session).
Sets the session cache expire time.
Gets the session cache expire time.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The cache expiration time in seconds.

docblock.description: Sets the session cache limiter value.
Gets the session cache limiter value.
Sets the session cookie params.
docblock.long-description:
Param array keys are:

  • lifetime : Lifetime of the session cookie, defined in seconds.

  • path : Path on the domain where the cookie will work. Use a single slash ('/') for all paths on the domain.

  • domain : Cookie domain, for example 'www.php.net'. To make cookies visible on all subdomains then the domain must be prefixed with a dot like '.php.net'.

  • secure : If TRUE cookie will only be sent over secure connections.

  • httponly : If set to TRUE then PHP will attempt to send the httponly flag when setting the session cookie.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The array of session cookie param keys and values.

docblock.description: Gets the session cookie params.
Gets the current session id.
Regenerates and replaces the current session id; also regenerates the CSRF token value if one exists.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True is regeneration worked, false if not.

docblock.description: Sets the current session name.
Returns the current session name.
Sets the session save path.
Gets the session save path.
Returns the current session status:
docblock.long-description:
• PHP_SESSION_DISABLED if sessions are disabled.
  • PHP_SESSION_NONE if sessions are enabled, but none exists.
  • PHP_SESSION_ACTIVE if sessions are enabled, and one exists.

A session segment; lazy-loads from the session.
The session manager.
The segment name.
The data in the segment is a reference to a $_SESSION key.
Constructor.
Checks to see if the segment data has been loaded; if not, checks to see if a session has already been started or is available, and then loads the segment data from the session.
Forces a session start (or reactivation) and loads the segment data from the session.
Returns the value of a key in the segment.
Sets the value of a key in the segment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value to set it to.

docblock.description: Check whether a key is set in the segment.
Unsets a key in the segment.
Clear all data from the segment.

Sets a read-once flash value on the segment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key for the flash value.

docblock.description: Reads the flash value for a key, thereby removing it from the session.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key for the flash value.

docblock.description: Checks whether a flash key is set, without reading it.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if it is set, false if not.

docblock.description: Clears all flash values.
